title: Code Health Refactoring Patterns
details:
## Code Health Improvement Patterns (v1.6.3)

### 1. Function Decomposition Pattern
When a function has cc>9 or "Bumpy Road" pattern:
- Split into focused helper functions
- Use format-specific handlers (e.g., extractFromUnifiedFormat, extractFromLegacyFormat)
- Add format detection helpers (e.g., isUnifiedFormat)

### 2. Options Object Pattern
When function has >4 parameters, refactor to options object:
```javascript
// Before (6 args):
buildQuickTabData(url, quickTabId, position, width, height, title)

// After (1 arg):
buildQuickTabData({ url, id, position, size, title })
```

### 3. Validation Best Practices
- Always validate options object exists: `if (!options) throw new Error(...)`
- Use default values for nested objects: `const { position = {} } = options`
- Array checks: `Array.isArray(arr) ? arr : []`
- Object checks: exclude arrays with `!Array.isArray(state)`

### 4. Code Health Score Improvements Achieved
- sidebar/quick-tabs-manager.js: 8.95 → 9.68 (+0.73)
- src/content.js: 8.29 → 8.55 (+0.26)
